text: [Music]
I'm Nicholas Kristof from the New York
Times here in Bahrain a few hours ago
there was a brutal government crackdown
on peaceful pro-democracy protesters at
least 600 of those injured were brought
here to the hospital about 10 ambulance
paramedics were attacked when they tried
to render help to the injured and
ambulances from this hospital are now
barred from going out on calls unless
specifically dispatched by the interior
ministry I put my hand like this to
protect my head they bit me on my hand I
belong to this country who are there and
I am doing my my duty where they are
beating me the doctors then told me to
go to the mortuary I am married I have
one son I'm working in the company as a
laborer my brother also he's finished
his study he's working as a laborer and
we don't want this Prime Minister why
he's doing like this this is our country
not him country I'm not a Bahraini I
can't say what the future this country
should be but it sure seems to me that a
man has a point
when his brother has been killed and he
says that a king who opens fire around
his own people doesn't have the right to
be king
